com.microsoft.windowsazure.services.blob.models

Class GetBlobOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microsoft.windowsazure.services.blob.models.BlobServiceOptions
      • com.microsoft.windowsazure.services.blob.models.GetBlobOptions

  • public class GetBlobOptions
extends BlobServiceOptions
    Represents the options that may be set on a getBlob request. These options include an optional server timeout for the operation, a snapshot timestamp to specify a snapshot, a blob lease ID to get a blob with an active lease, an optional start and end range for blob content to return, and any access conditions to satisfy.

        public GetBlobOptions setTimeout(java.lang.Integer timeout)
        Sets the optional server request timeout value associated with this GetBlobOptions instance.

        The timeout value only affects calls made on methods where this GetBlobOptions instance is passed as a parameter.

        Overrides:
        setTimeout in class BlobServiceOptions
        Parameters:

      • getSnapshot

        public java.lang.String getSnapshot()
        Gets the snapshot timestamp value set in this GetBlobOptions instance.
        Returns:
        A String containing the snapshot timestamp value of the blob snapshot to get.

      • setSnapshot

        public GetBlobOptions setSnapshot(java.lang.String snapshot)
        Sets an optional snapshot timestamp value used to identify the particular snapshot of the blob to get properties, metadata, and content for. The snapshot timestamp value is an opaque value returned by the server to identify a snapshot. When this option is set, only the properties, metadata, and content of the snapshot are returned.

        Note that this value only affects calls made on methods where this GetBlobOptions instance is passed as a parameter.

        Parameters:
        snapshot - A String containing the snapshot timestamp value of the blob snapshot to get.
        Returns:
        A reference to this GetBlobOptions instance.

      • getLeaseId

        public java.lang.String getLeaseId()
        Gets the lease ID to match for the blob set in this GetBlobOptions instance.
        Returns:
        A String containing the lease ID set, if any.

      • setLeaseId

        public GetBlobOptions setLeaseId(java.lang.String leaseId)
        Sets an optional lease ID value to match when getting the blob. If set, the lease must be active and the value must match the lease ID set on the leased blob for the operation to succeed.

        Note that this value only affects calls made on methods where this GetBlobOptions instance is passed as a parameter.

        Parameters:
        leaseId - A String containing the lease ID to set.
        Returns:
        A reference to this GetBlobOptions instance.

      • isComputeRangeMD5

        public boolean isComputeRangeMD5()
        Reserved for future use. Gets a flag indicating whether to return an MD5 hash for the specified range of blob content set in this GetBlobOptions instance.
        Returns:
        A flag value of true to get the MD5 hash value for the specified range, otherwise false.

      • setComputeRangeMD5

        public GetBlobOptions setComputeRangeMD5(boolean computeRangeMD5)
        Reserved for future use. Sets a flag indicating whether to return an MD5 hash for the specified range of blob content.

        When the computeRangeMD5 parameter is set to true and specified together with a range less than or equal to 4 MB in size, the get blob operation response includes the MD5 hash for the range. If the computeRangeMD5 parameter is set to true and no range is specified or the range exceeds 4 MB in size, a ServiceException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        computeRangeMD5 - Reserved for future use. Set a flag value of true to get the MD5 hash value for the specified range, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        A reference to this GetBlobOptions instance.

      • getRangeStart

        public java.lang.Long getRangeStart()
        Gets the beginning byte offset value of the blob content range to return set in this GetBlobOptions instance.
        Returns:
        The beginning offset value in bytes for the blob content range to return.

      • setRangeStart

        public GetBlobOptions setRangeStart(java.lang.Long rangeStart)
        Sets an optional beginning byte offset value of the blob content range to return for the request, inclusive.

        When this value is set, the blob content beginning at the byte offset specified by the rangeStart value and ending at the range end value, inclusive, is returned in the server response to the get blob operation. If the range end is not set, the response includes blob content from the rangeStart value to the end of the blob.

        Note that this value only affects calls made on methods where this GetBlobOptions instance is passed as a parameter.

        Parameters:
        rangeStart - The beginning offset value in bytes for the blob content range to return, inclusive.
        Returns:
        A reference to this GetBlobOptions instance.

      • getRangeEnd

        public java.lang.Long getRangeEnd()
        Gets the ending byte offset value for the blob content range to return set in this GetBlobOptions instance.
        Returns:
        The ending offset value in bytes for the blob content range to return.

      • setRangeEnd

        public GetBlobOptions setRangeEnd(java.lang.Long rangeEnd)
        Sets an optional ending byte offset value of the blob content range to return for the request, inclusive.

        If the range start is not set, this value is ignored and the response includes content from the entire blob.

        Note that this value only affects calls made on methods where this GetBlobOptions instance is passed as a parameter.

        Parameters:
        rangeEnd - The ending offset value in bytes for the blob content range to return, inclusive.
        Returns:
        A reference to this GetBlobOptions instance.

      • getAccessCondition

        public AccessConditionHeader getAccessCondition()
        Gets the access conditions set in this GetBlobOptions instance.
        Returns:
        An AccessCondition containing the access conditions set, if any.

      • setAccessCondition

        public GetBlobOptions setAccessCondition(AccessConditionHeader accessCondition)
        Sets optional access conditions for getting the blob. The operation will return an error if the access conditions are not met.

        Note that this value only affects calls made on methods where this GetBlobOptions instance is passed as a parameter.

        Parameters:
        accessCondition - An AccessCondition containing the access conditions to set.
        Returns:
        A reference to this GetBlobOptions instance.
